metadata.dc:description: Eosinophilic cholecystitis is a rare finding characterized by an inflammatory infiltrate composed primarily of eosinophils. We report a case of eosinophilic cholecystitis associated with hepatic hydatic cyst ruptured into the biliary tract. The release of hydatid cyst content into the biliary tract may have induced a hypersensitivity reaction with numerous eosinophils in the gallbladder wall.
metadata.dc:title: Colecistitis eosinofílica asociada a ruptura de un quiste hidatídico hepático en vías biliares.
[Eosinophilic cholecystitis associated with rupture of hepatic hydatid cyst of the bile ducts].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de enfermedades digestivas : organo oficial de la Sociedad Espanola de Patologia Digestiva
